data.name: OGRe
data.description: An object-oriented general relativity package for Mathematica.

evidence: README mentions binaries/installers: "* **Run from local file with installation:** This is the recommended option, as it allows you to permanently use the package offline from any Mathematica notebook. Download the file `OGRe.m` from [the"

"OGRe is a modern Mathematica package for differential geometry and tensor calculus, designed to be both powerful and user-friendly. It can be used in a variety of contexts where tensor calculations are needed, in both mathematics and physics, but it is especially suitable for general relativity."

"This package is compatible with Mathematica 12.0 or newer. It consists of only one file, `OGRe.m`." and usage via ``Needs["OGRe`"]`` / `Get["OGRe.m", ...]` indicate it is imported as a library into notebooks, not run as a standalone app.
